intro: Berla monspeliensium, commonly known as the French bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and features opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped flowers in shades of blue or purple, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long flowering period and ability to thrive in various garden conditions.
